intro: Carex neokukenthaliana, commonly known as the Kukenthalian sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Carex neokukenthaliana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
